newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Soy shipping conditions at key Brazilian ports.
newsitem.headline: Soy shipping conditions at key Brazilian ports.

text.p: Key Brazilian ports reported the following conditions for shipments of soybeans and soy products:

Vessels: Heron loading 31,500 tonnes soybeans. Sea Trader loading 28,000 tonnes soymeal. Sun P loading 55,000 tonnes soybeans. Vitastar loading 55,698 tonnes soybeans. Humber loading 55,000 tonnes soybeans/meal. Stjepov waiting to dock, to load 27,000 tonnes soymeal. 15 vessels waiting to load soymeal, 11 to load soybeans and two load mixed cargoes (soymeal/corn and soybeans/meal).
Stocks: No figures available. NOTE: Stevedores halted work for one hour in sympathy with strikers at Santos but loading of grains at the export terminal was not be affected.

Vessels: Loading of most vessels was paralyzed due to a strike by stevedores which was scheduled to last until April 5. Huta Kotowice was docked at the port authority terminal to load 54,000 tonnes soybeans but was not operating. Aghia Trias was docked at the Cargill private terminal to load 59,126 tonnes soybeans but also not operating. Hilon of Sparta waiting to dock to load 55,000 soybeans.
Road: 289 trucks arrived on April 3 unloading 7,662 tonnes soybeans and 17 trucks arrived unloading 421 tonnes soymeal.
Rail: 89 wagons arrived unloading 5,009 tonnes soymeal and 27 wagons arrived unloading 1,430 tonnes soymeal.
